title: Normal Distribution: Mitchell's Serve
question_text:
The distribution of the speed of Mitchellâ€™s tennis serve is approximately normal with a mean of $105.9$ miles per hour and a standard deviation of $7.4$ miles per hour.
If Mitchell is asked to serve at $80$%, which expression represents the speed (in miles per hour) at the $80$th percentile of this distribution?
solution:
The distribution is stated as normal therefore we can use the z-score formula.

If $x$ is an observation from a normal distribution with a known mean and standard deviation, the z-score of $x$ is:

$$z=\dfrac { \text{x-mean }}{ \text{standard deviation} } $$

1) Substitute the values into the formula:

$$z=\dfrac { x-105.9 }{ 7.4 }$$

2) We need to find the z-score for $80$%. This can be done either by using the calculator or table A.

Method 1: Using the TI-84 calculator:

Press 2nd then Vars to get into the distribution menu. Using the InvNorm function enter:



Area represents the area to the left. In this case, we want the cutoff for the bottom $80$% so the area would be $0.80$. The mean and standard deviation of a z-score are $0$ and $1$ respectively.

Method 2 for finding the z-score of $80$%: Using table A:

Look in the middle of the chart look for an entry closest to $0.80$. This is the entry corresponding to a z-score of $0.84$.

Solve for $x$:

$$0.84=\dfrac { x-105.9 }{ 7.4 } \\ (0.84)(7.4)=(\dfrac { x-105.9 }{ 7.4 } )(7.4)\\ (0.84)(7.4)+105.9=x-105.9+105.9\\ 0.84(7.4)+105.9=x$$

Choice 'E' is our answer.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect as the z-score of $-0.84$ is the $20$ percentile of the distribution.

Choice 'B' is incorrect as $-0.80$ is not the z-score for the $80$th percentile.

Choice 'C' is incorrect as $0.20$ was found from taking $100$% minus $80$%.

Choice 'D' is incorrect as $0.80$ represents the $80$th percentile and not the z-score for $80$ percent.
